body.description: Powered by NVIDIA DLSS 3, ultra-efficient Ada Lovelace architechture, and full ray tracing 4th Generation Tensor Cores: Up to 4x performance with DLSS 3 3rd Generation RT Cores: Up to 2x ray tracing performance Powered by GeForce RTX 4060 Ti Integrated with 16GB GDDR6 128-bit memory interface WINDFORCE Cooling System, RGB Fusion, Dual BIOS, Protection metal back plate. Ahead of its time, ahead of the game is the GIGABYTE GeForce RTX 4060 Ti GAMING OC 16G Graphics Cards. Powered by NVIDIA's new RTX architecture, the GIGABYTE GeForce RTX 4060 Ti GAMING OC 16G brings stunning visuals, amazingly fast frame rates, and AI acceleration to games and creative applications with its enhanced RT Cores and Tensor Cores, along with a staggering 16 GB of GDDR6 memory.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.6 4.6 out of 5 stars 152 ratings 4.6 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A little on the expensive side, but I personally think it’s worth it.
reviews.reviewText: I started out with a 1050 ti for just basic gaming, then got me a 3060 which could run most games at high settings, but now with the new stuff coming out I wanted to play games that support Raytracing but also having a steady 60fps experience, and so I decided to pull the trigger and get me this 4060 Ti. When compared to the previous generation it really isn’t that BIG of an upgrade because most games out right now don’t even support RTX or NVIDIA DLSS 3.0, but for next gen gaming it handles it pretty good. Graphics wise at least, because performance is just about the same as my previous 3060. Fortnite with Unreal Engine 5 looks ridiculously good with everything on Epic settings I hit about 60 fps with casual drops to 45 or so. The one thing I love about this thing is that despite it having 3 fans, it’s really quiet. I thought it was gonna be louder than my previous one since now it was bigger and had more fans, but if anything it got quieter.Overall I’m happy with it. Could I have waited for the 50 series instead? Yes. But, as new games come out, they all look shiny and pretty but not being able to play them myself would have felt like missing out. If you have the money and just wanna try out newer graphics and dont care about performance ALL that much, then I think this will do great things for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Bang for My Buck!
reviews.reviewText: I needed a good upgrade to my Nvidia GeForce RTX 2060 Super and I wasn't looking to break the bank. This RTX 4060Ti provided me with that answer. It's fast, handles video and games very well. and is quieter than my 2060 Super. If you can't afford the 4080's and 4090's of the world, the 4060Ti is a wonderful alternative.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A little expensive, but personally i'm happy with this GPU. I can run elden ring on high settings with max fps (60), without any stuttering. Easy to install, and no sagging. The upgrade from my former gtx 1060 3gb to this was huge.I had some problems when i tried enabling ray tracing. There would be a lot of keyboard input delay, but I am not sure if this is something with the gpu, software or some of my other components.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast, cool and quiet
reviews.reviewText: I like that it has 2 HDMI and 2 display ports. Most similar cards have 3 display ports and only 1 HDMI. I am not a gamer, but I do some video work and CAD (3D modelling) work. The fans have never kicked on. Completely silent. I have many Gigabyte products and have never been disappointed by them. Nice looking card as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This GPU has a problem with the mounting bracket, it sticks too short from the screws, I had to bend my case by 3mm in order to get the middle screw in. But once its working, its a really good GPU.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic GPU for the price
reviews.reviewText: I was seriously considering the Gigabyte 3070, but when I came across this and saw that it had slightly better specifications and that it was about $70 cheaper at the time, I decided to go with this, and I couldn't be happier. I can run the newer Call of Duty games with very high (almost highest) graphics settings, and I can run fairly high graphics settings on sim racing games using VR. If you are very serious about playing VR games from a PC with insane graphics settings and could afford to go with a better spec GPU, then I would recommend doing so. However, I'd say that this GPU is more than enough in most circumstances.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm a happy gamer!
reviews.reviewText: I'm a happy gamer! I use a HP G2 VR Headset while flying DCS. This works great as a replacement to my 3080.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Huge upgrade to my 2060 that I had previously. Super easy to install, uses the same connectors that the old card did, without drawing too much power. Arrived right on time, and was packaged well to include an anti static bag. As soon as I put this in and I optimized for balanced use, all of my settings were set to max and it handles it without hiccups. I see no reason to buy a 4090ti unless you are doing some major rendering, because for gaming, this card does wonderfully.
Great card for a build not too expensive, works great but a little too expensive but happy with it

Gigabyte está haciendo un muy buen trabajo con estas gpu, muy buenos materiales, grande, fácil de instalar y funciona de maravilla pra juegos de Call of Duty, battlefield, pubg, etcetc. Tengo un R5 5600x, 32gb de ram a 3600mhz. Funciona y se ve uff y aún faltan configurar algunas cosas 10/10
This went into my grandson's computer. He is impress
Came from gtx 1080ti for a long run of 6years am not that much disappointed with the performance

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth it IF upgrading from low end card
reviews.reviewText: Works great upgraded from a 1650 to the 4060 its an amazing worthwhile upgrade if you had what i did but not so much if you had a 3060 or something then it turns into a side-grade
